175.title: Thanks for putting me to good use: SRK to 'Desperately Seeking Shah Rukh' author
175.article_body: Writer Shrayana Bhattacharya, who wrote the book 'Desperately Seeking Shah Rukh', met the actor on Sunday and gave him a copy of her book. The actor gave Shrayana a handwritten note, writing, "Thank you for putting me to some good use. My love and thanks to you and all those wonderful women who like me so much."

176.title: K'taka makes face masks, social distancing mandatory amid COVID-19 surge
176.article_body: The Karnataka government on Monday issued guidelines making face masks mandatory in public places, workplaces and on public transport amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in parts of the country. People have been asked to maintain social distancing, a minimum of two feet, in public places, an official order said. Spitting in public places will be punishable with a fine.

177.title: More than half of India’s 900 million workforce stop looking for jobs: Report
177.article_body: More than half of the 900 million Indians of legal working age aren't looking for jobs, data from the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) has indicated. In March 2022, the labour force shrunk by 3.8 million to 428 million, marking its lowest since July 2021, data showed. The overall labour participation rate dropped from 46% to 40% during 2017-2022.

178.title: Ex-Mumbai Mayor arrested over attack on Somaiya, granted bail later
178.article_body: Former Mumbai Mayor and Shiv Sena leader Vishwanath Mahadeshwar and three others were arrested on Monday in connection with an attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya. However, the ex-Mayor was granted bail on medical grounds later, Mumbai Police said. Somaiya had on Saturday claimed that he was injured in an alleged stone-pelting incident by Shiv Sena workers in Mumbai.

179.title: I'm trying very hard to do justice to Smita Patil's legacy: Prateik
179.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar, speaking about his scene with his late mother Smita Patil's portrait in 'Cobalt Blue', has said, "It's a feeling I find difficult to articulate." "It will forever be a precious moment and memory for me," he added. Speaking about making correct career choices, Prateik said, "I'm...trying...hard...I hope people feel that I'm indeed doing justice to her legacy."

180.title: Have to take permission from wife Mira to spend money: Shahid Kapoor
180.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has said that he has to take permission from his wife Mira Rajput to spend money. "I would spend all out before but now I am a family man...I have to give it thought," he further stated. Shahid, however, added that he did not take permission for his recent boys' trip as it comes under his "rights".

181.title: Kannada television actress Rashmi Prabhakar marries Nikhil Bhargav
181.article_body: Kannada television actress Rashmi Prabhakar tied the knot with Nikhil Bhargav in Bengaluru on Monday. Nikhil works at an advertising agency and the couple met through mutual friends. Television actor Chandan Kumar shared a picture with the couple. Rashmi and Nikhil got engaged in November 2021. Their wedding was attended by family members and friends observing the COVID-19 norms.

182.title: Amazing to enter top-10 on same date as my idol Nadal: 18-yr-old Alcaraz
182.article_body: After entering top 10 for first time in his career at the age of 18 on Monday, Spain's Carlos Alcaraz said he's happy. He added that it's "amazing" to do it on same date like his idol Rafael Nadal did 17 years ago. Alcaraz climbed two spots from 11 to nine in ATP world rankings after winning 2022 Barcelona Open.

183.title: Cong has been tried, tested & dusted; see no future for it: KT Rama Rao
183.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday said that Congress has been tried, tested and dusted, adding that he sees no future for the party. "We've no relations with Congress. It's a redundant institution. The people of India gave them opportunities for over 50 years. The country has been let down by Congress and BJP," he said.

184.title: Indian sailors held captive by Houthi rebels released: MEA
184.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs on Monday said that seven Indian sailors, who were under the detention of Houthis in Yemen since January 2, 2022, have been released. According to MEA, the sailors reached Muscat, Oman, on April 24 and were expected to travel back to India shortly. The Centre thanked all the concerned authorities for the sailors' release.

185.title: HC refuses to quash FIR against Amravati MP and her MLA husband
185.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Monday refused to quash an FIR filed against Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana, both arrested in connection with the Hanuman Chalisa row. The concerned FIR alleged that the couple jostled and argued with the police when they were asked to get in the police vehicle after being arrested.

186.title: No need to display religious sentiments in public: Sharad Pawar
186.article_body: Amid a political row in Maharashtra over the recitation of Hanuman Chalisa, Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar on Monday said there is no need to display religious sentiments in public. "If efforts are made to spread hatred against communities or classes, adverse effects would be seen in society. Maharashtra never experienced this," he said.

187.title: Deposed Myanmar leader Suu Kyi awaits verdict in corruption case trial
187.article_body: A Myanmar court on Monday deferred its first verdict in corruption case trial of deposed leader Aung San Suu Kyi, for which she could face jail time of up to 15 years. Her verdict was postponed to Tuesday, Reuters reported quoting a source. Suu Kyi, who was arrested during coup, has been accused of misappropriating charity money, among other allegations.

188.title: Poland, Sweden to organise donor conference to raise funds for Ukraine
188.article_body: Poland and Sweden will organise an international donor conference in Warsaw on May 5 to raise funds for Ukraine amid its invasion. "The conference will initiate a series of aid events...in...upcoming months," the event's press release stated. According to UN, an estimated 13 million people in Ukraine are in need of humanitarian aid, including shelter, food and medical supplies.

189.title: Twitter set to accept Musk's $43 billion offer: Report
189.article_body: Twitter is set to agree on its sale to the world's richest man, Elon Musk, for around $43 billion in cash, Reuters reported on Monday. It is the price that Musk had called his "best and final" offer for the social media company. Twitter may announce the $54.20-per-share deal later on Monday, Reuters added.

190.title: Musk responds to his alleged old e-mail on Twitter, Instagram; shares 'Instagram curse'
190.article_body: Elon Musk, who has offered to buy Twitter, responded to an e-mail he allegedly wrote in August 2018 about Twitter and Instagram. In the e-mail, Musk allegedly wrote, "Will tweet as I wish and suffer the consequences...I just deleted my Instagram. Weak sauce." On Monday, Musk responded to the e-mail by tweeting, "The Instagram curse: Water everywhere, yet always thirsty."

191.title: 'Ultimate finisher' Dhoni is the identity of IPL: Irfan Pathan
191.article_body: Calling MS Dhoni the "greatest and ultimate finisher" in IPL's history, Irfan Pathan said CSK wicketkeeper-batter is the identity of the league and its true ambassador. "Year after year, someone else has been joining this list but no one has been able to displace Dhoni," he added. Dhoni has scored 120 runs from seven matches in IPL 2022 so far.

192.title: Carlos Alcaraz is a future world number one: Prakash Amritraj
192.article_body: After Carlos Alcaraz won the Barcelona Open, former tennis player Prakash Amritraj took to Twitter and opined that the 18-year-old Spaniard will be men's world number one tennis player in the future. "He is going to be part of whatever big number exists at the time," Amritraj further tweeted. Carlos defeated Pablo Carreno Busta in the Barcelona Open final.

193.title: India finishes with 28 medals at Brazil Para Badminton International 2022
193.article_body: India ended its campaign at Brazil Para Badminton International 2022 in Sao Paulo with 28 medals, which includes eight golds, seven silvers and 13 bronzes, on Sunday. World number three Sukant Kadam won a silver in the SL4 category after losing to fellow Indian Tarun Dhillon in the final. Tokyo Paralympics gold medallist Pramod Bhagat secured 2 bronze medals.

194.title: CSK to bowl first against PBKS, PBKS make 3 changes to their playing XI
194.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain Ravindra Jadeja won the toss and elected to bowl first against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. PBKS have made three changes to their playing XI, with Shahrukh Khan, Nathan Ellis and Vaibhav Arora being replaced by Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Sandeep Sharma and Rishi Dhawan. CSK are fielding the same playing XI.

195.title: RBI moving towards managing inflation won't hurt growth: FM
195.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the RBI's plan to begin moving towards management of inflation wouldn't hurt India's economic growth. "The growth is not getting compromised, because [government] policies...have also been in such a way that supply-side supports have continued including infrastructure investments," she stated. She also defended RBI's timing to pivot toward inflation.

196.title: BMW to help create tool to trace carbon footprint of batteries
196.article_body: A group of 11 carmakers and battery producers, including BMW, has received $8.78 million from Germany to develop a "battery passport". The German government said the tool will trace the content and carbon footprint of batteries in Europe. This comes as from 2024, rechargeable EVs, light transport and industrial batteries sold in Europe might have to disclose their carbon footprint.

197.title: I'm typecast as 'urban girl next door', looking to break it: Barkha
197.article_body: Actress Barkha Singh in an interview has stated that she is often typecast as an urban girl next door", adding the magazine covers have called her the digital girl next door. "I'm looking to break out of that image to do something a little more desi. There has to be a way to come around it," the actress added.

198.title: India's GDP expected to grow 7.5-8% in FY23: CII President
198.article_body: Confederation of Indian Industry's (CII) President TV Narendran said India's GDP is expected to grow 7.5-8% in FY23, with exports playing a key role. Referring to the Russia-Ukraine war, Narendran said no country can remain unaffected from events taking place outside its borders. "Even though India's...economic engagement with Russia or Ukraine is low, this does not shield us," he added.

199.title: He'll find a way to battle through it: Vettori on Kohli's form in IPL 2022
199.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's form in IPL 2022, ex-New Zealand spinner Daniel Vettori said the RCB batter will find a way to battle through it, adding the way is through his "aggressive" nature. Kohli, who has scored 119 runs in eight matches so far with an average of 17, got out for golden ducks in the last two matches.

200.title: Indonesia's palm oil export ban will exclude crude palm oil: Reports
200.article_body: Palm oil companies were told by Indonesian government officials on Monday that the export ban on palm oil wouldn't cover export of crude palm oil, Reuters reported citing sources. President Joko Widodo had announced on Friday that palm oil exports would be banned in Indonesia from April 28. He said the export ban aims to ensure domestic food product availability.

201.title: Actress Chhavi Mittal dances in hospital before her breast cancer surgery
201.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently revealed that she is fighting breast cancer, danced in the hospital before her surgery. Sharing a video of her dance video on Instagram, the actress wrote, "Doc said, Chhavi...You need to chill! So I'm chilling #preppingforsurgery." In an earlier post, the actress wrote, "Early detection is the only key and it's worth every effort."

202.title: SDMC to launch month-long anti-encroachment drive
202.article_body: The BJP-ruled South Delhi Municipal Corporation will launch a month-long anti-encroachment drive at several places, civic authorities said on Monday. "Encroachers will not be spared," said SDMC Mayor Mukesh Suryan, adding that before the anti-encroachment drive is launched, notices will be sent to those who have encroached upon public land, roads and footpaths.

203.title: Pune Police seize cache of 11 illegal weapons worth ₹3.35 lakh
203.article_body: The Pune Police crime branch has recovered a cache of 11 illegal weapons worth ₹3.35 lakh and 14 live rounds from four people including one dealer. The first arrest was made after the officials of unit 6 learned about a possible weapon sale in Wagholi. The accused shared information about the people who bought weapons from him in police custody.

204.title: Free booster COVID vaccine shots for all aged above 18 at Haryana govt centres
204.article_body: The Haryana government on Monday announced that it will provide free booster COVID-19 vaccine doses to the eligible population aged above 18 at government vaccination centres. This will cost the state government ₹300 crore, the Haryana Directorate of Information said. The state has about 1.2 crore beneficiaries in the 18 to 59 years age group, it added.

205.title: Japan sends envoy to Solomon Islands over China security pact worry
205.article_body: Japan sent its Vice Foreign Minister Kentaro Uesugi for a three-day trip to Solomon Islands on Monday amid concerns over latter's security pact with China. Uesugi's trip comes after US sent a delegation to Solomon Islands and warned of action if a permanent Chinese military presence is set up there. Australia and New Zealand have also voiced concerns over pact.

206.title: Ishan Kishan had a miserable time batting against LSG: Sunil Gavaskar
206.article_body: Ex-India batter Sunil Gavaskar said MI's Ishan Kishan had a "miserable time" batting against LSG on Monday. "Ishan just walked off [after his dismissal]...he just wanted to get out of his misery," he stated. Ishan was dismissed on the bowling of Ravi Bishnoi after the ball bounced off LSG wicketkeeper Quinton De Kock's shoe and Jason Holder took the catch.

207.title: Gadkari announces Pune-Aurangabad expressway, to reduce travel time to 1.15 hrs
207.article_body: An access-controlled expressway will be constructed between Aurangabad and Pune at a cost of ₹10,000 crore, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari announced. This will reduce the travel time between the two cities to 1.15 hours. There will be no turns and the vehicles could move at a speed of up to 140 km per hour.

208.title: Cong to constitute 'empowered action group 2024' for Lok Sabha polls
208.article_body: Congress will constitute an 'empowered action group 2024' to address political challenges ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha polls, party leader Randeep Surjewala announced on Monday. The decision was taken after a meeting on poll strategist Prashant Kishor's proposal to revamp the party. Notably, this also comes amid speculations of Kishor joining Congress, although no formal announcement has been made yet.

209.title: Water supply to be hit for 12 hours in Kalyan, Dombivli tomorrow
209.article_body: Kalyan and Dombivli areas in Maharashtra's Thane district will face a 12-hour water cut from 8 am on Tuesday. The water cut has been announced in order to undertake the repairs and restoration work in Barave, Mohili, Netivali and Titwala water treatment plant. Kalyan Dombivli Municipal Corporation (KDMC) officials urged residents to use water sparingly during the next few days.

210.title: Govt blocks 16 YouTube news channels for 'spreading disinformation'
210.article_body: The government on Monday said it has blocked 16 YouTube news channels "for spreading disinformation related to India's national security, foreign relations and public order". Six of the blocked channels are Pakistan-based and 10 are based in India, the government has said. The channels "were spreading false...information to...incite communal disharmony and disturb public order", it said.

211.title: Lawyers 'manhandle' policemen outside Delhi court post assault on colleague
211.article_body: Two policemen were allegedly pushed and manhandled by lawyers outside the Karkardooma Courts Complex on Monday, who were protesting against the alleged assault on a colleague by a sub-inspector on Sunday. "Two police officers on Sunday misbehaved with lawyer Neeraj Jha, who went to the Nand Nagari police station to meet his client," said Shahdara Bar Association president VK Singh.

212.title: CBSE is Central Board of Suppressing Education: Rahul Gandhi
212.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday termed the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) as the 'Central Board of Suppressing Education'. This comes a few days after CBSE removed several chapters from the history and political science syllabus of classes 10 and 12. He also termed the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh as the 'Rashtriya Shiksha Shredder' for modification of the syllabus.

213.title: Israel embassy unveils street-art in Delhi, honours Indo-Jewish actors
213.article_body: The Israeli embassy on Monday unveiled a street-art mural in New Delhi's Connaught Place to mark 30 years of bilateral relations. The mural, inaugurated by Israeli Ambassador Naor Gilon and Minister of State for External Affairs Meenakashi Lekhi, highlights contributions of Indian-Jewish actors Nadira, Sulochana and Pramila. The mural was designed by Delhi Street Art Founder Yogesh Saini and team.

214.title: Father throws his 2 children in well in Jaunpur, both found dead
214.article_body: A man had allegedly thrown his two young children in a well in Naipoora village of the Jaunpur district in Uttar Pradesh. The bodies have been brought out of the well and have been sent for post-mortem, police said. Notably, the accused, Irfan's mental condition was not well since he returned from Saudi Arabia five years ago, police said.

215.title: Vijay Varma recreates Kareena's 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' dialogue
215.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma on Monday shared a video on Instagram recreating Actress Kareena Kapoor's viral dialogue from 2001 film 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham'. He wrote, "The only Gag I ever wanted to play with Kareena, the only and ultimate Poo." Kareena also joins him making funny faces. They shot the video on the sets of 'The Devotion of Suspect X'.

216.title: Pleased with the way we competed: Lampard after Everton's loss to Liverpool
216.article_body: Despite Everton slipping into the EPL's relegation zone after a 2-0 defeat against Liverpool on Sunday, manager Frank Lampard has said that he is "pleased with the way" Everton competed. "In terms of performance, I am more positive...There are 18 points to fight for...It is important for the players...not to get...into that in a negative way," Lampard said.

217.title: Thane woman loses ₹71.15 lakh to man who promised her a crematorium tender
217.article_body: A 54-year-old woman from Maharashtra's Thane was cheated of ₹71.15 lakh by a man who promised her a tender for maintenance of a crematorium in Navi Mumbai. The woman has a water supply business and she had met the accused in 2017. The 28-year-old accused has been booked but he is yet to be arrested.

218.title: Thieves use bulldozer to dig out ATM machine in Maha, CCTV video goes viral
218.article_body: A now-viral video has shown thieves digging out an ATM machine using an excavator in the Miraj area of Maharashtra's Sangli. The incident took place on Saturday (April 23) at a booth of an Axis bank ATM carrying ₹27 lakh cash. The video shows the stolen bulldozer smashing the booth's glass door, digging the ATM out and dragging it.

219.title: 95% patients visiting Delhi mohalla clinics happy with services: CM
219.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said 95% of the patients visiting 'Aam Aadmi Mohalla' clinics in the national capital are satisfied with the services provided there. "We have opened two mohalla clinics in Delhi's most posh area, Greater Kailash, and a lot of rich patients also come to these centres," Kejriwal told Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann.

220.title: Twitter in final stages of negotiation for its sale to Elon Musk: Report
220.article_body: Twitter is in the final stretch of negotiations with the world's richest person, Elon Musk, about a potential sale of the microblogging site, Bloomberg reported on Monday. "Twitter could reach an agreement as soon as Monday," Bloomberg added, without specifying the date. A few days ago, Musk had said that he had secured $46.5 billion in funding to buy Twitter.

221.title: Over 1,000 people fined for not wearing face masks in Noida: Police
221.article_body: Over a thousand people were penalised across Noida and Greater Noida in a day after they were allegedly found without face masks in public places amid a rise in COVID-19 cases, police said on Monday. After a rise in the number of positive cases in Gautam Buddh Nagar, the UP government made wearing face masks mandatory in public places.

222.title: Jared Padalecki 'lucky' to survive 'bad car accident': Jensen Ackles
222.article_body: Actor Jensen Ackles has stated that his 'Supernatural' Jared Padalecki couldn't join a fan convention in New Jersey he was attending as the latter was in "a very bad car accident". Jensen further said that Jared is "lucky to be alive" thanks to the airbags. "He wasn't driving. He was in the passenger seat...Really, really bad car accident," Jensen added.

223.title: Twitter executives met Musk to discuss $43 bn takeover bid: Reports
223.article_body: Twitter executives met the world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Sunday to discuss his $43 billion takeover offer, reports said. The development comes after Musk revealed that he has secured $46.5 billion in funding to take the social media company private. Musk has been meeting with Twitter shareholders recently to seek support for his bid, Reuters reported.

224.title: Not satisfied with Police's status report on security at Delhi CM's home: HC
224.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday said it was not satisfied with the status report filed by the Delhi Police regarding security arrangement outside CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence, which was vandalised by a group of protesters. "You'd put up barricades...received intimation about the protest. But, what kind of 'bandobast' (arrangement) did you put in place," the court asked the police.

225.title: Those two are the best in history: Rublev on Nadal and Djokovic
225.article_body: Sharing his opinion on the GOAT (Greatest of All Time) debate, world number eight Andrey Rublev said both Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic "are the best in history". He added, "Now they are fighting for one of them to somehow prevail and be alone on that throne." Nadal is a 21-time Grand Slam champion, while Djokovic has won 20 Slams.

226.title: Power comes and goes, some are anxious after losing Maha polls: Pawar
226.article_body: NCP supremo Sharad Pawar commented on the BJP by saying that some people are "anxious" after losing the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly polls in 2019. "Power comes and goes...Some people are getting anxious...because before the state election, claims were made of coming again to power but it did not happen and hence they are anxious," Pawar said.

227.title: BJP forms 'weak booth committee' team ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha polls
227.article_body: BJP has constituted 'weak booth committee' team in a bid to make party stronger ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha elections, party leader Dilip Ghosh said on Monday. "There are four members per committee spread across [India]. The purpose of [this] is to expand BJP's presence wherever it's weak," Ghosh added. BJP's Baijayant Jay Panda also chaired meeting in this regard.

228.title: No target is too big for Dhoni when it comes to finishing the game: Hogg
228.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said no target is too big for MS Dhoni when it comes to finishing the game. "Whether it's 15 runs...or 30 runs an over, Dhoni...believes that he can get his team over the line," Hogg stated. On Thursday, Dhoni scored 16 runs in the last four balls of the final over to help CSK beat MI.

229.title: Liverpool back within 1 point of Man City after derby win vs Everton in PL
229.article_body: Liverpool moved back within one point of leaders Manchester City in the Premier League standings after a 2-0 win against Everton in the Merseyside derby on Sunday. Andy Robertson and Divock Origi scored for Liverpool in 62nd and 85th minute respectively. Meanwhile, Christian Pulisic netted a 90th-minute winner to help Chelsea beat 10-man West Ham United 1-0 at Stamford Bridge.

230.title: Mandhana engages in verbal fight with Rajasathan players after 'mankad' run-out
230.article_body: During a Senior Women's T20 League match against Rajasthan, Maharashtra opener Smriti Mandhana got involved in a verbal fight with the opposition players after being dismissed to a 'mankad' run-out. Mandhana was seen exchanging words with Rajasthan players while the decision was being referred to the third umpire. Mandhana got out for 28(30).

231.title: Will not tolerate invasion: Taliban on alleged Pakistan airstrikes on Afghanistan
231.article_body: Afghanistan's acting Defence Minister Mullah Mohammad Yaqoob has said Taliban would not tolerate "invasions" from its neighbours after Taliban administration blamed Pakistan for airstrikes that officials said killed dozens in Kunar and Khost provinces. Yaqoob said, "We have tolerated that attack...next time we might not tolerate it." Pakistan said the two countries are "brotherly countries".

232.title: Banks ask NPCI to clarify stance on UPI for crypto trading: Report
232.article_body: Several banks have asked the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) to issue a formal directive over restrictions regarding the use of United Payments Interface (UPI) to purchase and sell virtual digital assets, the Economic Times reported. Some banks have blocked UPI for crypto trading following "verbal instructions" from NPCI, the report said, adding a circular from NPCI is unlikely.

233.title: Had 15-min role, no idea how director changed it to 40 mins: Charan on Acharya
233.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said initially he had a 15-minute role in the movie 'Acharya'. "Pooja Hegde and I were just supposed to make cameo appearances. I've no idea how Siva developed it into a 40-minute role," he added. "Here, I'd like to thank director SS Rajamouli for allowing me to shoot for 'Acharya' amidst the filming of RRR," Charan said.

234.title: Dhoni's shoes can't be filled, but Jadeja definitely has it in him: Rayudu
234.article_body: CSK batter Ambati Rayudu has said that their captain Ravindra Jadeja has the leadership qualities in him not only to lead CSK but also Team India in the future. "Filling in MS Dhoni's shoes, it's never going to happen. But Jadeja definitely has it in him and under the guidance of Mahi bhai (Dhoni)...Jadeja will become better," he stated.

235.title: Rise in policy rates not anti-national activity: Raghuram Rajan
235.article_body: Politicians and bureaucrats need to understand that rise in policy rates isn't some anti-national activity benefiting foreign investors, ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan wrote on LinkedIn. He added, "Inflation's up in India...At some point, the RBI will have to raise rates, like the rest of the world." His remarks came as India's retail inflation reached a 17-month-high of 6.95% in March.

236.title: Mevani re-arrested in new case after getting bail in case over tweets on PM
236.article_body: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani was re-arrested in a new case just after he was granted bail on Monday by a court in Assam in case over tweets on Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Mevani had been taken back to the Kokrajhar Jail after the hearing. His counsel had earlier said that he had been granted bail and formalities were being completed.

237.title: Modern Love Mumbai starring Fatima, Arshad & Pratik Gandhi to release in May
237.article_body: Modern Love Mumbai starring actors Fatima Sana Shaikh, Arshad Warsi and Pratik Gandhi will release on May 13. The Mumbai chapter of the US original anthology series Modern Love, helmed by John Carney, has brought together six filmmakers Vishal Bhardwaj, Hansal Mehta, Shonali Bose, Dhruv Sehgal, Alankrita Shrivastava and Nupur Asthana. It will feature stories about discovering love.

238.title: Karan to return with 'Koffee with...'; new season goes on floors in May: Reports
238.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar and his team are reportedly gearing up to start shooting for the new season of 'Koffee with Karan'. According to reports, the planning and pre-production have already begun and the team is now ready to start shooting from mid-May. The show is expected to go on air in the month of June on Star Network, reports added.

239.title: BJP leader Tarachand Chheda dies aged 71 due to post-COVID-19 complications
239.article_body: Former minister and BJP leader Tarachand Chheda passed away aged 71 at his home in the Bhuj town of Gujarat's Kutch. Chheda had been suffering from post-COVID-19 complications after contracting the infection in January this year. "The viral disease left his lungs damaged which led to pneumonia and he could not recover from that," Chheda's younger son said.

240.title: Future Group shares fall up to 20% after Reliance cancels deal
240.article_body: Shares of Future Group companies plummeted on Monday, with Future Lifestyle Fashions and Future Supply Chain Solutions each trading 20% lower. Meanwhile, Future Retail stock dropped 5% to ₹27.80 per share.This comes after Reliance Industries called off its ₹24,713-crore deal to acquire Future Group's assets after secured creditors of the latter voted against the proposal.

241.title: 'KGF Chapter 2' becomes 6th highest-grossing Indian movie, earns ₹883 cr globally
241.article_body: Kannada film 'KGF Chapter 2' earnings jumped on Sunday, taking its total worldwide earnings to ₹883 crore, according to film trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan. The Yash-starrer film is now the sixth highest-grossing Indian film of all time, according to the film trade analyst. It overtook Aamir Khan's blockbuster PK's lifetime gross earnings of ₹854 crore, The Hindustan Times reported.

242.title: Heatwave predicted in 12 states & 1 UT in the next 5 days, list released
242.article_body: IMD has predicted heatwave conditions over the next five days in isolated pockets of Gujarat and Odisha. Heatwave is likely in north coastal Andhra Pradesh and sub-Himalayan West Bengal during April 25-27, in west Rajasthan and mid-Maharashtra during April 26-29 and in Bihar, Jharkhand during April 25-28. Punjab, south Haryana-Delhi, south UP, MP to face a heatwave during April 27-29.

243.title: AI helps Pune graduates prepare for interviews, apply for jobs
243.article_body: Over 3,000 students in less than 15 days have used Savitribai Phule Pune University's AI-assisted digital smart interview platform to prepare for upcoming interviews. "The industry has its requirements ready and they have the job openings as well, the AI is helping to identify which candidates can fit in and where," said Dr Nitin Karmalkar, Vice-Chancellor, SPPU.

244.title: RGV praises Kichcha Sudeepa's 'Vikrant Rona', calls it 'marvellous'
244.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to praise actor Kichcha Sudeepa's upcoming movie 'Vikrant Rona', writing, "Had...good fortune to see some 3D footage of 'Vikrant Rona'...And I must say it's looking next level. Absolutely marvellous." "Can't wait to see full film on July 28," he added. It will release in multiple languages, including Kannada, Hindi, Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam.

245.title: SC agrees to list pleas against removal of Article 370 after summer vacation
245.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to consider listing after summer vacation the pleas challenging the abrogation of Article 370. A bench comprising Chief Justice NV Ramana and Justice Hima Kohli took note of senior advocate Shekhar Naphade's submissions. "Let me see...This is a five-judge matter. I will have to reconstitute the bench," CJI Ramana said.

246.title: Fire breaks out at oil depot in Russia's Bryansk
246.article_body: A large fire broke out at an oil depot in Russia's Bryansk city, located about 154 km from the Ukrainian border, the country's Emergencies Ministry said on Monday. No injuries were reported in the incident and the authorities said that the need to evacuate the city did not arise. A probe has been ordered into the incident.

247.title: Was rejected for TV show, makers said they'll have to put on extra lights: Nawaz
247.article_body: Nawazuddin Siddiqui in an interview recalled an incident when a television show's team refused to cast him. "[They said] 'We'll have to put on extra lights, we've to send one episode every day...If we cast you, it'll take 1.5 days, we'll face losses...Better you find something else'," he said. Nawazuddin further said he then decided to find work in movies.

248.title: Philippines begins administering 2nd booster dose against COVID-19
248.article_body: The Philippines on Monday began administering a second COVID-19 vaccine booster shot to individuals with low immunity. According to the Philippines' Health Department, the initial rollout of these shots aims to inoculate about 7,000-13,000 persons deemed most vulnerable. South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore are among other Asian countries that have approved a second booster shot.

249.title: Don’t give more weapons to Ukraine: Russia tells US
249.article_body: Russia has asked the US to stop sending weapons to Ukraine. Russian ambassador to Washington Anatoly Antonov said that an official diplomatic note has been sent to the US in this regard. "We stressed the unacceptability of this situation when the US pours weapons into Ukraine and we demanded an end to this practice," Antonov said.

250.title: K'taka seeks report as B'luru school allegedly asks kids to carry Bible
250.article_body: A Karnataka block education officer visited the Bengaluru school which has been accused by right-wing group Hindu Janajagruti Samiti of imposing Bible on students. "I have come here to get a report from the school authority," he said. As per reports, the school took an undertaking from parents to allow students to carry Bibles.

251.title: Khevrajpur victims were raped before being killed, TMC alleges cover-up
251.article_body: The TMC on Monday alleged a "massive cover-up" in connection with the murder of five members of a family in Uttar Pradesh's Khevrajpur, with the party alleging that women were raped before being killed. In a series of tweets, TMC national spokesperson Saket Gokhale alleged the police were informed that the women were raped, but an FIR wasn't registered.

252.title: Bihar woman chokes husband to death by biting his throat during fight
252.article_body: A woman allegedly choked her husband to death by biting his throat in a village in Bihar's Rohtas district, police said. According to police, the accused committed the crime after she lost her temper during a quarrel with her husband. "The woman was aggressive in nature and often created tension in the joint family," the deceased's elder brother said.

253.title: Sachin Tendulkar's daughter taking acting classes, may debut soon: Report
253.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar's daughter Sara has been taking acting classes due to her brand endorsements and may make her Bollywood debut soon, reported Bollywood Life. The report further stated that she has studied medicine at London University but is interested in making a career in the glamour world. In 2015, there were reports of Sara making her debut opposite Shahid Kapoor.

254.title: Kim trolled for photoshopping her waistline in pics, fan says 'Something is off'
254.article_body: American television personality Kim Kardashian was trolled for photoshopping her recent poolside pictures, with people claiming she edited her waist. It was her midriff that drew the user's attention. One user said, "You forgot to leave in your belly button." "Something is off," another user commented. "You can see where you photoshopped your waist," the other user wrote.

255.title: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal joins Urban Company's board
255.article_body: Zomato Founder and CEO Deepinder Goyal has joined the board of online home services marketplace Urban Company as an independent director. The company has added three other members to its board, including McKinsey & Co's former partner Ireena Vittal, Helion Co-founder Ashish Gupta and PwC India's former Chairperson Shyamal Mukherjee. Founded in 2014, Urban Company entered unicorn club last year.

256.title: Building undergoing repairs collapses in Delhi; 5 labourers feared trapped
256.article_body: At least five labourers are feared trapped under the debris of a building that collapsed in Delhi's Satya Niketan on Monday, fire officials said, adding that efforts are being made to rescue them. The building was undergoing repair work at the time of the incident. Six fire tenders have reached the spot to carry out the rescue operation, officials added.

257.title: World's oldest living person, Japan's Kane Tanaka, passes away at 119
257.article_body: Japan's Kane Tanaka, who was declared the world's oldest living person by the Guinness World Records, passed away on April 19, 2022, aged 119. The news was confirmed by Senior Gerontology Consultant Robert Young, who also helped confirm Kane's record as the oldest person living and oldest person living (female) in 2019. Tanaka had recently been hospitalised and discharged repeatedly.

258.title: Airline ordered to pay ₹8,000 to man for broken wheel of bag at Bengaluru airport
258.article_body: A man in Bengaluru has won compensation of ₹8,000 from an airline after a wheel of his checked-in trolley bag broke. The incident happened in 2017. The judges hearing the case reportedly reprimanded the airline for service deficiency and ordered that the customer be paid ₹5,000 as compensation for the luggage and ₹3,000 for his court expenses within 45 days.

259.title: Sara Ali Khan to star in a film on 1942 Quit India Movement: Report
259.article_body: Sara Ali Khan has reportedly signed on to star in a film based on 1942 Quit India Movement. As per Pinkvilla, she'll play the lead role in the project which will be helmed by 'Ek Thi Daayan' director Kannan Iyer. The report stated that it'll be released on a digital platform and will be backed by Karan Johar's Dharmatic Entertainment.

260.title: India's Deepak wins 2nd straight silver at Asian Wrestling Championships
260.article_body: Indian wrestler Deepak Punia won a silver medal after losing to Kazakhstan's Azmat Dauletbekov 1-6 in 86kg weight category on the concluding day of Asian Championships 2022 in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, on Sunday. It was Deepak's fourth medal in the tournament, having won a silver (2021) and two bronze (2019, 2020) before. Overall, India finished its campaign with 17 medals.

261.title: Punjab will recreate Delhi's education model: CM Bhagwant Mann
261.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Monday said the state will recreate Delhi's education model where students from all economic backgrounds will have equal right to get quality education. "The revolution in education system is discussed across the country. We will replicate the same model in Punjab...The country will progress this way by learning from each other," Mann added.

262.title: All the people living in Hindustan are Indians, and are Hindu: BJP MP
262.article_body: Mansukh Vasava, Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MP from Bharuch Lok Sabha constituency, said that all people living in Hindustan are Indians and Hindus. "If all become Muslim or Buddhist or Christian then what will happen to Hindus in Hindustan? Have you ever imagined that? I'm not custodian of Hindu religion...Hindu religion is prevailing in entire Hindustan," he added.

263.title: Former Union Home Secy Madhav Godbole passes away at 85 in Pune
263.article_body: Former Union Home Secretary and IAS officer Madhav Godbole (85) passed away at his residence in Pune due to a cardiac failure on Monday, his family said. Godbole held several positions before retiring in 1993 including the Secretary of the Department of Justice. He held a PhD in economics from Mumbai University and an MA from Williams College, Massachusetts.

264.title: Didn't expect something like this: Verstappen after Imola GP win
264.article_body: Following a win at the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix at Imola, Red Bull driver Max Verstappen has said, "Coming into...weekend I didn't expect something like this but as a team...we executed everything very well." "That's always...hard to do at such an intense weekend with the sprint qualifying as well," he added. This is Verstappen's second Grand Prix win this season.

265.title: Barça are still in top 4 but we've made our lives complicated: Xavi
265.article_body: Speaking after a 0-1 defeat against Rayo Vallecano in La Liga, Barcelona head coach Xavi Hernández has said that his team is in a "tough situation". "We are still in the top four but we have made our lives complicated," Xavi stated. Barcelona are placed second on the La Liga points table with 63 points from 33 matches.

266.title: B'luru garbage trucks to have speed regulators to avoid accidents
266.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will install speed regulators on 588 of its garbage compactors to restrict their speed to 35 km per hour. This comes after a two-wheeler rider was killed by a speeding city garbage truck recently. "To avoid similar mishaps in the future, we'll be providing basic skill development training to drivers," an official said.

267.title: Lata Didi said 'won't do it even for 10cr dollars': Asha on singing at weddings
267.article_body: Veteran singer Asha Bhosle has revealed that her late sister and legendary singer Lata Mangeshkar once turned down an invite to sing at a wedding for 'millions' in compensation, saying, "We do not sing at weddings." Bhosle revealed, "They said they wanted Asha Bhosle and Lata Mangeshkar...[Didi]...told the rep, 'We will not sing even if you offer 10 crore dollars'."

268.title: 66-year-old ex-India cricketer Arun Lal to marry 38-year-old teacher Bul Bul Saha
268.article_body: Former India cricketer Arun Lal will tie the knot with 38-year-old Bul Bul Saha on May 2 in Kolkata. The 66-year-old has reportedly taken consent from his first wife Rina Devi, who is ailing. Arun and Rina have divorced, but they still live together due to her illness. Bul Bul is a school teacher by profession.

269.title: Priest arrested for denying Dalit couple entry into Rajasthan temple
269.article_body: A priest has been arrested for allegedly not allowing a Dalit couple to offer prayers at a temple in Rajasthan's Jalore, police said. In a video footage, the priest is purportedly seen stopping the couple at the temple gate and getting into an argument with them. Rajasthan minister Mahesh Joshi condemned the incident and said all religions are equal.

270.title: I'm upset with party's leadership in Gujarat: Cong's Hardik Patel
270.article_body: Gujarat Congress Working President Hardik Patel on Monday said he isn't upset with Congress leaders Rahul or Priyanka Gandhi but with the party's state leadership. "Elections are coming up...Work should be done together with honest and strong people. They should be given positions," Patel said. He had earlier said his position in Congress is like a groom forced into 'nasbandi'.

271.title: Navneet Rana alleges 'casteist abuse' in jail, says 'not allowed to drink water'
271.article_body: The MP from Maharashtra's Amravati Navneet Rana has alleged she was denied "basic human rights" and "abused in the most filthy language" over her caste in jail. Rana, writing to Lok Sabha Speaker, said she was denied drinking water only because of her caste. "I was told...'we don't let people from 'neechi zaat' Scheduled Castes use our bathrooms'," she alleged.

272.title: HC grants protection to interfaith MP couple who eloped and got married
272.article_body: Nearly 20 days after an interfaith couple from Madhya Pradesh eloped and got married in a temple in Chhattisgarh, MP High Court's Jabalpur bench restrained police from taking action against the man in a kidnapping case lodged by the woman's family. This comes after the Dindori administration demolished three shops and house belonging to the man's family, citing "illegal construction".

273.title: Didn't want to give her a small role: Director on cutting Kajal's role in Acharya
273.article_body: Director Koratala Siva spoke about cutting Kajal Aggarwal's role in 'Acharya'. He said it was inappropriate to cast the actress in a role with no clear ending. "Initally, Kajal's role was designed as a funny role, but after viewing the rushes, I thought it wasn't right to place a star actress in such a small-length role," he added.

274.title: Don't believe in too many changes in the playing XI: Rohit Sharma
274.article_body: On being asked about the Singaporean batter Tim David not featuring in the playing XI, Mumbai Indians skipper Rohit Sharma said that he doesn't believe in "too many changes". "We want to make sure whoever gets a chance...gets a run in the XI. So we try not to make too many changes...That's how I look at it," Sharma said.

275.title: KTR inaugurates Ferring pharmaceutical facility in Hyderabad
275.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao inaugurated the Ferring Pharmaceuticals' laboratories plant at Genome Valley in Hyderabad on Monday. The Swiss pharmaceutical company's facility has been established with an investment of an estimated €30 million (over ₹240 crore) and will reportedly provide employment to over 100 people. The company caters to reproductive medicine and maternal health products.

276.title: Heroin worth ₹280 cr seized from Pak boat off Guj coast; 9 held
276.article_body: A joint team of the Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad and Indian Coast Guard apprehended nine Pakistani nationals off Gujarat's Jakhau coast and seized over 50 kg of heroin worth ₹280 crore, police said. The accused used a boat named Al Haj to bring in the drugs at the behest of a Pakistani smuggler, said the Director-General of Gujarat Police Ashish Bhatia.

277.title: US oil falls below $100 mark as China lockdowns stoke demand fears
277.article_body: Oil price fell below the $100 mark again on Monday as prolonged COVID-19 lockdowns in China stoked fears regarding waning demand for oil. While US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell $4.11 to $97.96/barrel, Brent crude fell $4.63 to $102.02/barrel. Oil prices also likely weakened on the prospect of higher interest rates in the US, which is boosting the US dollar.

278.title: Who are now the world's 10 richest people as Adani becomes 5th richest?
278.article_body: Gautam Adani overtook Berkshire Hathaway's Warren Buffett to become the world's 5th-richest person with $123.7 billion wealth, Forbes said. Elon Musk is the richest worldwide with $269.7 billion in wealth, followed by Jeff Bezos, LVMH's Bernard Arnault & family and Bill Gates. Buffett is 6th-richest, followed by Larry Ellison, Google Co-founder Larry Page, Mukesh Ambani and Google's Sergey Brin.

279.title: Health Ministry organises awareness activities across India on World Malaria Day
279.article_body: The Union Health Ministry organised various awareness activities across India on Monday  on World Malaria Day. Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya also called for prioritisation of malaria elimination through national and sub-national efforts. "Our efforts have resulted in 86.45% decline in malaria cases and 79.16% reduction in malaria related deaths in 2021 as compared to 2015," Mandaviya said.

280.title: World no. 8 Rublev beats Djokovic to win 3rd title of 2022 at Serbia Open
280.article_body: World number eight Andrey Rublev defeated world number one Novak Djokovic 6-2, 6-7(4-7), 6-0 at Serbia Open to win his third title of the season on Sunday. With this, the Russian has now equalled Rafael Nadal's mark of most titles in 2022. Meanwhile, women's world number one Iga Swiatek won Stuttgart Open for her fourth straight title of the season.

281.title: Jasprit Bumrah has less threatening performances than Shaheen: Aqib
281.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Aqib Javed has said that Shaheen Shah Afridi's graph as a pacer is on the rise, whereas, Jasprit Bumrah's graph is stable. "Bumrah's isn't that aggressive...He has less threatening performances than Shaheen, whether it's in T20Is, ODIs or...Tests," Aqib stated. Shaheen has taken 201 wickets in 94 international games. Bumrah has 303 wickets in 156 international games.

282.title: Minor girl gang-raped in Jharkhand’s Ranchi; 3 arrested
282.article_body: Three persons were arrested for allegedly raping a minor girl in Jharkhand's Ranchi, police said on Monday. "Gang-rape with a minor was reported in Chanho police station area of rural Ranchi last evening," said police. "All accused are known to the victim. They called her to meet, then took her to a secluded place and raped her," added police.

283.title: Anushka shares video from her training for 'Chakda 'Xpress', Jhulan reacts
283.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to share a video showing how she's preparing for 'Chakda 'Xpress', an upcoming film based on the life of Indian cricketer Jhulan Goswami. "That's how the last few days have been," she captioned the video where she's seen practising on a field. Jhulan reacted to Anushka's post and dropped a few clapping hands emojis.

284.title: Confident about Asian Games to be held in September: OCA official
284.article_body: The Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) remains confident about the Asian Games to go ahead in Hangzhou in September, a senior official told Reuters. "The OCA has written to Beijing to get more clarity on the situation...The matter will be taken up for discussion at the OCA executive board meeting in Tashkent on May 6," the official said.

285.title: Villagers attack police team in MP, free illegal liquor case accused from custody
285.article_body: A group of villagers allegedly attacked 12 police personnel with sticks and stones and freed an illegal liquor trade case accused from their custody in Madhya Pradesh's Tikamgarh district. Five police personnel sustained injuries in the incident and windowpanes of two police vehicles were also damaged, an officer said. A case has been registered against 20 persons, including women.

286.title: Akshay Kumar asks fans to suggest title for 'Soorarai Pottru' remake
286.article_body: Akshay Kumar on Monday asked fans to suggest a title for his Hindi remake of Suriya's 2020 Tamil film 'Soorarai Pottru' on social media. The untitled film, which co-stars Radhika Madan, is inspired by the life of Air Deccan founder Captain GR Gopinath and is directed by Sudha Kongara. Fans suggested titles like 'Ucchai', 'Uchayee' and 'Udaan' among others.

287.title: Bitcoin falls to six-week low, Ether declines nearly 5%
287.article_body: Bitcoin fell as much as 3.2% to $38,236 on Monday, marking the crypto's lowest level since March 15. The world's largest cryptocurrency extended this month's losses as investors shied away from risk assets amid a more hawkish outlook for US Federal Reserve policy tightening. Ether, the second-biggest crypto, also slumped 4.8% to $2,799, a level not seen since March 18.

288.title: Casey Affleck joins cast of Christopher Nolan's 'Oppenheimer'
288.article_body: Casey Affleck has joined the cast of Christopher Nolan's next film 'Oppenheimer'. A few pictures of the actor from the sets of the film have surfaced online. 'Oppenheimer' also stars Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr and Emily Blunt. The film, which is based on the life of American physicist J Robert Oppenheimer, is expected to release on July 21, 2023.

289.title: Apple's crypto rules raise potential antitrust issues: Coinbase CEO
289.article_body: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said Apple has banned a "bunch of features" on its mobile application which creates room for "potential antitrust issues". "Apple so far has not really played nice with crypto," Armstrong said. He added that he believes crypto-compatible phones could be "quite popular" in the future and that smartphone makers should start preparing crypto-specific hardware features.

290.title: Pune entrepreneur wins US award for giving clean potable water solutions
290.article_body: A Pune-based entrepreneur, Rahul Pathak, has won a gold prize at the Edison Awards ceremony in the United States. He won the award for his innovative solution of making clean potable water available quickly at affordable prices for people facing natural calamities. He said, "We are planning to reach the most vulnerable population who are affected by disasters."

291.title: Claims tribunal members to visit violence-hit Khargone on April 26
291.article_body: Two members of a claims tribunal formed by the Madhya Pradesh government will visit violence-hit Khargone to assess damages on April 26. Several properties were damaged when communal clashes broke out after a Ram Navami procession was disrupted in the city. The state government conducted a demolition drive to raze illegal properties following the violence.

292.title: Adani Power sixth Adani group firm to hit ₹1 lakh cr m-cap
292.article_body: Adani Power became the sixth Adani Group firm to cross ₹1 lakh-crore market valuation after its shares hit an all-time high of ₹272 apiece on Monday. The stock has risen over 100% in a month and about 290% since hitting a 52-week low of ₹69.95 in August 2021. Earlier, Adani Green Energy and Adani Transmission, among others, hit this milestone.

293.title: BTS' Jimin's home seized over unpaid health insurance, released later
293.article_body: South Korean band BTS member Jimin's Seoul apartment was seized by National Health Insurance Service over non-payment of his health insurance premiums. The apartment was reportedly seized in January and released on April 22 after the premiums were paid. BTS' agency Big Hit released a statement apologising for the negligence saying that a portion of Jimin's mail had been omitted.

294.title: Amid temperature rise, Bihar temple installs fans, ACs for deities
294.article_body: A Bihar temple has installed fans and air conditioners to protect deities from heat, amid the rising temperature in several parts of north India. "With the help of fans, coolers and ACs, common people are protecting themselves from the heat...thinking on the same lines...we have installed same for Gods and Goddesses here," President of ISKCON temple, Gaya, said.

295.title: KL Rahul has matured way beyond his age: Kevin Pietersen
295.article_body: Ex-England skipper Kevin Pietersen called LSG captain KL Rahul a dynamic player, who has matured way beyond his age. Pietersen added, "To continue scoring runs for different franchises is a damn hard (thing)...there's so much pressure...when you get bought for such big money." The 30-year-old is currently the second-highest scorer in IPL 2022, with 368 runs in eight games.

296.title: 'KGF' director, producer kiss Yash after film's success, picture surfaces
296.article_body: After success of 'KGF: Chapter 2', the distributor of the film, Hombale Films, shared a picture where film's director Prashanth Neel and producer Vijay Kiragandur can be seen kissing actor Yash on the cheeks. "It's just the beginning," Hombale Films wrote. Fans took to the comments section to share old pictures of the trio in the same pose.

297.title: SBI employee cheats 75-yr-old woman of ₹45 lakh in Hyd, arrested
297.article_body: A State Bank of India (SBI) employee was arrested by Hyderabad Police on Friday for allegedly cheating a 75-year-old woman of ₹45 lakh. The accused had promised to help victim download mobile banking app and then gained access to her account by replacing her registered phone number with his number. Accused availed overdrafts on victim's fixed deposits of ₹45 lakh.

298.title: India a technological powerhouse: EU chief on launching trade, tech body with India
298.article_body: India and the European Union (EU) on Monday launched the India-EU Trade and Technology Council to tackle challenges in trade, trusted technology and security. "We have India as a technological powerhouse," said EU chief Ursula von der Leyen while holding talks with PM Narendra Modi in Delhi. Till now, EU only had one such council in place with the US.

299.title: People said 'This is why you are gay': Saisha on being sexually assaulted as a child
299.article_body: Talking about being sexually assaulted as a child, designer Saisha Shinde said, "The few people whom I told about it, they said to me 'This is why you are so much into sex, this is why you are gay'." "I never gathered the courage to talk about it after that," Saisha added on 'Lock Upp'.

300.title: Prasoon Joshi's mother Sushma Joshi passes away
300.article_body: Lyricist and Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) chief Prasoon Joshi's mother Sushma Joshi passed away on Sunday. Sushma had worked with All India Radio for over three decades. She was also a lecturer of political science and a classical singer. Her last rites were held at Ram Bagh Shamshan Bhumi in Gurugram.

301.title: MP Navneet Rana being mistreated at Mumbai's Byculla jail: Fadnavis
301.article_body: Maharashtra BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis alleged MP Navneet Rana was being mistreated at Byculla jail, not given drinking water and wasn't allowed to go to washroom in night. "The whole government machinery is scared of one woman," Fadnavis said. Navneet and her MLA husband were arrested after they gave a call for chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside CM Uddhav Thackeray's home.

302.title: Don't get involved in civil disputes: Owaisi to party workers
302.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has asked his party workers not to get involved in civil disputes, especially after an AIMIM corporator Nazir Ahmed Honyal was arrested in the Hubballi stone-pelting incident in Karnataka. "I have come here to advise you all to not interfere in any kind of land or construction issues...Let the law take its own course," Owaisi said.

303.title: Swiggy programme to let delivery partners get managerial-level jobs
303.article_body: Swiggy has launched an accelerator programme called 'Step Ahead' to help its delivery partners get managerial-level jobs with a fixed salary and become full-time Swiggy employees. Swiggy intends to reserve at least 20% of fleet manager hires for its delivery executives. A Swiggy delivery executive "must hold a college degree, possess communication skills and basic computer knowledge" for the role.

304.title: India's military spending 3rd highest in the world at $76.6 billion: Report
304.article_body: India's military spending in 2021 was the third highest in the world at $76.6 billion, according to the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI). The five largest spenders in 2021 were the United States, China, India, the United Kingdom and Russia. US military spending reached $801 billion in 2021, while China spent $293 billion on defence.

305.title: Comedienne Bharti Singh shares first picture of her baby boy
305.article_body: Comedienne Bharti Singh on Sunday shared the first picture of her baby boy on Instagram, writing, "Life line." Bharti and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa welcomed their son earlier this month. She resumed working 12 days after giving birth and was criticised for leaving her child at home. Bharti had responded saying there are some work commitments that cannot be ignored.

306.title: Cyient to buy Finland's Citec for €94 mn in its largest-ever acquisition
306.article_body: Hyderabad-based engineering and technology solutions provider Cyient announced on Monday it has signed definitive agreements to acquire Finland-based Citec, in its largest acquisition to date. Cyient will acquire the plant and product engineering services company for €94 million in an all-cash deal. It will be the largest outbound acquisition by an Indian engineering services company, Cyient said.

307.title: I will be finished the day I start taking audience for granted: Nawazuddin
307.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said reinventing as a performer is the only way to not become "jaded" in the film industry. "The day I stop the process thinking that the audience will love me anyway as I am a great actor, my downfall will begin," he added. "If I take that love, the audience for granted, I am finished," Nawazuddin said.

308.title: Billie Eilish trips during Coachella performance; jokes 'I just ate s***, ouch!'
308.article_body: Billie Eilish fell over on her face during her Coachella 2022 performance. She tripped on stage right after the stage lights dimmed as the singer was getting ready to perform her song 'Getting Older'. After tripping, the singer gathered herself and joked with the crowd saying, "I just ate s**t! Ouch...I'm good. It was dark!"

309.title: Provide relief to farmers, don't make false promises: Punjab Cong chief to Kejriwal
309.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja on Sunday asked AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal to provide relief to the farmers instead of making "fake" and "false" claims and promises. "Nobody stops you and your party’s government in Punjab from providing relief to farmers which you promised, why are you not doing that?" Raja added.

310.title: Medical college in Haryana village to be named after Guru Tegh Bahadur: CM
310.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said that a government medical college being built in Haryana's Panjupur village, Yamunanagar district will be named after Guru Tegh Bahadur. The foundation of the college will be laid within three months. Khattar made the announcement while addressing an event organised in Panipat to mark the 400th birth anniversary of Guru Tegh Bahadur.

311.title: Tap water to homes in Bundelkhand-Varanasi by 2024 is govt's priority: UP minister
311.article_body: UP Jal Shakti Minister Swatantra Dev Singh said it is the government's priority to ensure the supply of clean drinking tap water to the homes of the poor living in villages from Bundelkhand to Varanasi (Kashi) by 2024. The government is working continuously to provide pure tap water to the people in the last line of the society, Singh added.

312.title: J'khand schools told to suspend morning assembly, sports amid COVID-19 surge
312.article_body: The Jharkhand School Education and Literacy Department has asked schools to suspend morning assembly, cultural programmes and sports activities amid rising COVID-19 cases in some states. The schools have been asked to conduct regular health check-ups in coordination with nearest health centres and district administrations have been directed to ensure random COVID-19 tests of students and teachers.

313.title: Female tiger cub found dead in MP's Bandhavgarh Reserve
313.article_body: A female tiger cub was found dead in Madhya Pradesh's Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve (BTR) on Sunday. According to BTR's field director BS Annigeri, the 7-8-month-old cub's carcass showed serious injury marks on the head, stomach, back and ears, in the Dhamokhar buffer zone. It is suspected that the cub was killed in an attack by a male tiger, official said.

314.title: Hindutva is culture, not chaos: Shiv Sena on Hanuman Chalisa issue
314.article_body: Hindutva is a culture and not chaos, Shiv Sena said in an editorial in its mouthpiece, Saamana, on Monday. The statement comes amid the ongoing Hanuman Chalisa issue in the state. "The ruckus that the Bharatiya Janata Party has started in the name of Hindutva at the moment cannot be supported," Shiv Sena said.

315.title: Adani overtakes Buffett to become world's 5th richest person: Forbes
315.article_body: Adani Group's 59-year-old Chairman Gautam Adani has overtaken Berkshire Hathaway's 91-year-old CEO Warren Buffett to become the world's fifth-richest person with a net worth of over $123.7 billion as of Friday's close, Forbes said. Adani's net worth stood at $8.9 billion just two years ago, Forbes added. Shares of Adani's businesses are up by between 19% to 195% this year.

316.title: Inzamam-ul-Haq's only Test hit-wicket dismissal came off Monty Panesar
316.article_body: England's Monty Panesar, who turns 40 today, is the only bowler to get ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq out hit-wicket in Test cricket. Trying to sweep Panesar during a Test in 2006, Inzamam lost balance and hit the stumps while attempting to jump over them. Panesar represented England in 50 Tests, with his maiden wicket being that of Sachin Tendulkar.

317.title: 'Extras' joint top-scored in ODI cricket's lowest-ever total
317.article_body: On April 25, 2004, Zimbabwe were dismissed for the lowest-ever ODI total of 35 in 18 overs against Sri Lanka. As many as four Zimbabwe batters got out for ducks while Dion Ebrahim top-scored with 7, same as the number of extras conceded by Sri Lankan bowlers. Sri Lanka won the match by 9 wickets, with 244 balls remaining.

318.title: Vehicle license number 'AA8' sold for ₹73 crore in Dubai
318.article_body: A unique license plate number has been sold for around ₹73 crore (35 million Dirhams) at a charity auction in Dubai. The number is reportedly the third most expensive license plate number in the world. License plate numbers 'F55' and 'V66' were also sold at the auction for four million Dirhams (approximately ₹8.34 crore) each.

319.title: Empty train damages platform after derailing at station in Chennai, pic surfaces
319.article_body: A train climbed the platform after derailing at the Beach station in Chennai on Sunday. The empty Electric Multiple Unit (EMU) was being moved from the yard to platform when the incident happened. The driver jumped out of the train and is undergoing treatment at a hospital, an official said. No case has been registered against him, the official added.

320.title: Akshay, Radhika Madan begin shooting for 'Soorarai Pottru' remake
320.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Radhika Madan have started shooting for the Hindi remake of Suriya-starrer film 'Soorarai Pottru'. Akshay took to his social media handles on Monday to share a video showing him and the actress beginning the filming with a coconut-breaking ritual. The yet-untitled remake will be directed by Sudha Kongara, who also helmed the original film.

321.title: CM Bommai should be held responsible: DK Shivakumar on PSI scam
321.article_body: Amid the controversies surrounding the police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam in Karnataka, Congress state President DK Shivakumar has criticised the CM Basavaraj Bommai-led state government. "Why did the CM say in the assembly that no mistakes happened in PSI recruitment? He should also be held responsible for lies. Why did he give the case to CID now?" Shivakumar asked.

322.title: Mumbai man held for circulating woman's pvt pics on Insta, blackmailing her
322.article_body: A 21-year-old man from Mumbai allegedly circulated private photos of a 19-year-old woman on Instagram and further blackmailed her in order for her to share her intimate photos with him. Police, with the help of Instagram, tracked down the accused and arrested him. "Any woman who is being threatened in such a manner must approach local police," an officer said.

323.title: NCP leader seeks permission to chant religious prayers at PM's house
323.article_body: NCP leader Fahmida Khan wrote a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday seeking permission to chant prayers of all religions, including namaz, Hanuman Chalisa, Namokar Mantra and Guru Granth Sahib, outside PM Narendra Modi's residence in Delhi. "If Hindutva, Jainism...[can help] the country...reduce inflation, unemployment [and] starvation, I would like to do it," she said.

324.title: 35-yr-old woman stripped and assaulted publicly on camera in Karnataka; 9 booked
324.article_body: A 35-year-old tribal woman was allegedly stripped and assaulted by a group of people in Dakshina Kannada district of Karnataka. The incident took place over a land dispute on April 19 and came to light when a video showing the mob stripping the woman as dozens looked on went viral. Police have booked nine persons in the case.

325.title: Tom Cruise's 'The Mummy' is probably the biggest failure of my life: Maker Alex
325.article_body: Alex Kurtzman, who helmed the action-adventure film 'The Mummy', has said the Tom Cruise-starrer film is "probably the biggest failure" of his life, "both personally and professionally". "There's about a million things I regret about it, but it also gave me...many gifts that are inexpressibly beautiful," he added. The film, which was released in 2017, also featured Russell Crowe.

326.title: TN passes Bill to acquire Guv's power to appoint vice-chancellors to universities
326.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Monday passed a Bill seeking to take over the Governor's power to appoint vice-chancellors to universities. CM MK Stalin said the state government's lack of power to appoint vice-chancellors impacts higher education in the state. "Even in...Gujarat, one of the three candidates recommended by state government's search committee is appointed vice-chancellor," he added.

327.title: Need to have a chat with other coaches: Jayawardena on MI's batting
327.article_body: After their eighth straight defeat in IPL 2022, MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena said he needs to have a chat with the other coaches to review their performance. "Batting has been a problem area. We have batted under par," Jayawardena added. "We've not hit our straps...we're [also] not taking early wickets...batsmen are scoring centuries against us," he further said.

328.title: Lata Mangeshkar’s brother Hridaynath admitted to hospital, son says he's 'stable'
328.article_body: Late singer Lata Mangeshkar's brother Hridaynath Mangeshkar has been admitted to a hospital, his son, singer Adinath Mangeshkar confirmed on Sunday. Adinath added that the doctors have said that Hridaynath is getting better and will get discharged from the hospital in 10 days. "By the grace of God, he will be back home...He is stable and doing well," Adinath said.

329.title: It was over the top: Parthiv on Krunal's reaction after taking Pollard's wicket
329.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel has criticised LSG all-rounder Krunal Pandya for the send-off he gave to MI's Kieron Pollard after dismissing him in their match on Sunday. "It's important to give people space...In the dressing room, you can have as much banter as you want...But, this reaction was over the top," stated Parthiv. Krunal kissed Pollard after taking his wicket.

330.title: Dogs found feeding on corpse of woman missing for 6 days in Punjab
330.article_body: A group of dogs was found feeding on the corpse of a woman who had been missing for the last six days in Punjab's Ludhiana. The police have only found skeletal remains of the deceased woman, Guddi Devi. Her daughter identified her with the help of a necklace. Police said that they are waiting for a postmortem report.

331.title: Global military spending hits record high, passes $2 trillion in 2021: Report
331.article_body: The global military spending hit a record high in 2021, crossing $2 trillion for the first time. It reached $2.113 trillion, 12% higher than in 2012, according to a report by Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI). "Even amid the economic fallout of the COVID-19 pandemic, world military spending hit record levels," said a researcher at SIPRI.

332.title: Panic buying in Beijing amid fears of Shanghai-like lockdown
332.article_body: The Chinese reportedly resorted to panic buying, stocking up food and supplies, in Beijing amid fears of a Shanghai-like lockdown after the authorities ordered mass testing in the Chaoyang district. The residents of Chaoyang have been asked to get tested for COVID-19 three times this week. This comes after the district reported several COVID-19 cases.

333.title: Not going to be easy: Manjrekar on Karthik's T20 WC chances
333.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has said it's not going to be easy for RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik to get into India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "When you say we want DK in team, you want a guy out...We'll have to start looking at Hardik Pandya vs Karthik. It's not going to be easy," he explained.

334.title: 2 robbers snatch man's debit card outside Pune ATM, steal ₹2 lakh
334.article_body: Two unidentified robbers allegedly snatched the debit card of a man who was coming out of an ATM in Pune's Dehu on Sunday and stole ₹2 lakh by making multiple transactions, police said. According to the police, one of the accused asked the man to show his debit card and when he refused, the duo snatched it and ran away.

335.title: Very definition of luck deserting you: Harsha Bhogle on Kishan's 'unusual' dismissal
335.article_body: Referring to MI opener Ishan Kishan's dismissal against LSG, Harsha Bhogle said, "If you want to know the very definition of luck deserting you, you just saw the entire novel, the entire screenplay." Kishan got caught out in slips after the ball bounced off wicketkeeper Quinton De Kock's shoe. Meanwhile, Nick Knight said, "You would not believe it."

336.title: 5 including 4 Indian tourists killed in car-bus collision in Nepal
336.article_body: Four Indian tourists were among five persons who were killed after their car collided with a bus in Nepal's Dhading district, police said. The four Indian nationals were returning to Kathmandu after visiting Pokhara when the accident took place. The Nepalese driver of the car was also killed in the accident.

337.title: Man kills brother after developing feelings for sister-in-law in UP: Police
337.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police arrested a man for killing his brother after he allegedly developed feelings for his sister-in-law. The man, Bhupendra Sahu, lived with his brother, Mohit, and sister-in-law in Lucknow. "Bhupendra...started making advances towards her. Mohit's wife...complained...to her husband...brothers had argument over this and Bhupendra overpowered Mohit and slit his throat," police said.

338.title: 3 critically endangered Sumatran tigers found dead in Indonesia
338.article_body: Three critically endangered Sumatran tigers were found dead in Indonesia's Aceh, authorities said on Monday. The tigers, whose population has decreased to about 400, were found with injuries caused due to snare traps, an official said. Under Indonesian law, people who intentionally kill protected animals face up to five years of imprisonment and 100 million rupiah fine (about ₹5.3 lakh).

339.title: IPL share video of Ishan Kishan's wicket, say 'Most bizarre dismissal in IPL?'
339.article_body: The IPL have shared the video of Mumbai Indians (MI) opener Ishan Kishan's dismissal against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), writing, "Most bizarre dismissal in IPL? Ishan’s unusual wicket." Kishan was dismissed on the bowling of Ravi Bishnoi after the ball bounced off the shoe of LSG wicketkeeper Quinton De Kock and was caught by Jason Holder in the slips.

340.title: Jamia shooter Rambhakt Gopal shares video of gun pointed at kids in Haryana
340.article_body: Rambhakt Gopal, the shooter who fired at an anti-CAA protest near Jamia Millia University in 2020, has shared a video showing a gun pointed out of an SUV at children and women in Haryana. Another video shows a group of men brandishing pistols and dragging a man into an SUV, with the caption "Taking away the cow smuggler" on Instagram.

341.title: Hunt on for 2 suspects in Nigeria oil blast; death toll rises to 110
341.article_body: A local oil official said on Sunday that the search for two suspects involved in the blast at an oil refining depot in Nigeria's Rivers has been intensified. This comes as a disaster management agency official told AFP that the death toll from the blast has risen to 110. The country's President had called it a "catastrophe and national disaster".

342.title: B'luru woman dies as husband physically assaults, locks her in bedroom
342.article_body: A 48-year-old woman died after her 55-year-old husband physically assaulted her in Bengaluru. Reports said that the husband also locked her in the bedroom for three hours after rendering her unconscious. Their son, who filed a complaint with the police, said his father even used a wooden stick to hit his mother.

343.title: Hated my Mumbai school, was bullied & teachers were not nice to me: Shahid
343.article_body: Shahid Kapoor in an interview spoke about his school life and revealed that he was bullied in his Mumbai school. "I hated my school in Mumbai...I was treated very badly and my teachers were also not very nice to me," he added. "I loved my...[Delhi] school, I was there from Jr KG and I'd a lot of friends," Shahid said.

344.title: Shiv Sena workers still giving threats: Somaiya over 'attack'
344.article_body: Following the alleged attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya, a BJP Mumbai unit delegation will meet the Union Home Secretary in New Delhi on Monday, the state BJP said. "We'll give a detailed report and demand a special team for inquiry," Somaiya said. "Fake FIR was registered against me. Shiv Sena workers are still giving threats," Somaiya stated.

345.title: 3 bike-borne persons loot ₹80,000 from money changer in Dhuri
345.article_body: Three bike-borne persons allegedly took away ₹80,000 and a mobile phone from a money changer at gunpoint in Punjab's Dhuri on Sunday afternoon. The victim was working at his shop when two persons entered inside and pointed a pistol at him while the third person remained seated on a motorcycle outside the shop, police said.

346.title: 168 killed, 98 hurt in tribal clashes in Sudan's Darfur: Aid group
346.article_body: At least 168 people were killed and 98 others were injured in tribal clashes between Arabs and non-Arabs in Sudan's Darfur region, the General Coordination for Refugees and Displaced in Darfur spokesperson Adam Regal said. He added that the clashes first began on Thursday with the killing of two people. Authorities have deployed troops in the area following the clashes.

347.title: Youth strangles pregnant girlfriend for pressuring him for marriage in Ghaziabad
347.article_body: A 19-year-old youth has been arrested for allegedly strangling his pregnant girlfriend to death with a dupatta in Ghaziabad. Police said that the accused, who was in a relationship with the girl for the past few months, was fed up with her constant appeals to get married. Police had to form several teams to arrest the man, who was absconding.

348.title: Police caught me by shoulder, almost pushed me into a warehouse: Pratik on VIP movement
348.article_body: Actor Pratik Gandhi described on Twitter how he felt "humiliated" by police's actions when he started walking on road to reach shoot location amid jam due to "VIP movement". Pratik revealed police caught him by shoulder and "almost" pushed him into a warehouse. After a Twitter user mentioned that PM Narendra Modi was in Mumbai, Pratik replied, "Oops...I didn't know."
