349.title: Man stabbed to death by his 3 uncles on UP street as passersby watch, act caught on CCTV
349.article_body: A man, in his 20s, was stabbed to death by his three uncles in broad daylight on a street in UP's Meerut on Sunday afternoon. As per police, the uncles had an argument with the deceased, Sajjid, on Saturday and Sunday morning. Police have collected the CCTV footage of the murder and are investigating the matter.

350.title: J&K will soon set example of development for country: LG Manoj Sinha
350.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha on Sunday said it was a big day for the UT as PM Narendra Modi laid the foundation stones and inaugurated development works worth over ₹20,000 crore. J&K will soon set an example of development for the country, Sinha added. "Now, all laws have been implemented which are helping women and people of J&K," Sinha stated.

351.title: Photo of UP Crime Branch officer smoking hookah with top criminal goes viral
351.article_body: A photo of UP Crime Branch officer Mohammad Asif smoking hookah with a top criminal named Ankit Lala has surfaced on social media. After the photo of Asif sitting with Kanpur's Ankit Lala went viral, the officer was suspended and an enquiry was ordered, reported India Today. Samajwadi Party shared the news on Twitter and demanded action against the officer.

352.title: UP Police's sniffer dog passes away, given farewell with state honours
352.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police's sniffer dog, Vicon, passed away on Sunday due to prolonged illness. Vicon, who was born in 2011, was appointed as sniffer dog for the explosive section in the dog squad of Uttar Pradesh Police in 2012. Vicon was given a final farewell by salute with state honours by senior police officials.

353.title: I don't want to get ahead of myself: KL Rahul on 4th IPL hundred
353.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul, who slammed his fourth IPL hundred on Sunday, has said he doesn't want to get ahead of himself and is only playing according to the situation in the ongoing IPL season. "Enjoying batting, enjoying the responsibility. Fingers crossed I can keep doing the right things," he added. Rahul scored 103* off 62 balls against MI.

354.title: Attempts being made to divide Tamil Nadu on basis of caste & religion: Stalin
354.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Sunday said attempts are being made to divide the state on the basis of caste and religion. "Some people want to stop the development of the state by dividing us. The people of Tamil Nadu should realise this and act," Stalin added. "Only a peaceful country can achieve all kinds of development," Stalin stated.

355.title: 2 labourers injured in explosion at venue of event in J&K's Rajouri
355.article_body: Two persons were injured in an explosion that took place in Shahpur village of Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Sunday evening. Police said the two injured persons, both local labourers, have been shifted to a nearby hospital. The explosion took place when organisers at an event were packing things at the end of the occasion.

356.title: Maximum temperature in parts of Delhi may touch 45-46°C by April 28: IMD
356.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that the maximum temperature in some parts of Delhi could reach around 45-46°C on April 27 and 28. According to the IMD, there may be some relief from April 28 onwards due to the impact of a western disturbance expected across northwest India. Safdarjung recorded a maximum temperature of 39.5°C on Sunday.

357.title: US officials meet Ukraine Prez, announce military aid
357.article_body: A US delegation, including Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin, met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv. The US announced military aid worth $322 million and approved a $165 million sale of ammunition to Ukraine. The US said it will gradually restart embassy operations in Ukraine and the diplomats would return to the war-torn country.

358.title: Mahesh Babu's next with Rajamouli likely to go on floors in Dec: Report
358.article_body: Mahesh Babu's next film with filmmaker SS Rajamouli, tentatively titled 'SSMB29', is expected to go on floors in December this year, according to a report. The actor, who recently completed shooting for his upcoming action-drama 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata', has reportedly flown to Dubai where he'll discuss the script with Rajamouli. 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata' is slated to release on May 12.

359.title: 102 kg heroin worth ₹700 cr from Afghanistan seized at Attari
359.article_body: Indian Customs seized 102 kg of heroin hidden in a consignment of liquorice (mulethi) that was imported from Afghanistan at the Attari check post, officials said. The contraband was concealed in several cylindrical logs resembling liquorice and is worth ₹700 crore in international market, officials added. "We're taking action under NDPS Act," Customs Commissioner of Amritsar, Rahul Nangare, said.

360.title: Drinking water gets 'mixed with sewage' in Punjab; 15 fall sick
360.article_body: As many as 15 people, including seven children, have fallen ill after consuming contaminated drinking water in the Gazipur area in Punjab's Zirakpur. Residents alleged that the water supply was contaminated by sewer lines. A telecom company had dug up the area to lay wires, which has caused the mixing of water with sewage, a water supply department official claimed.

361.title: I try to direct films that aren't easy to make: Ajay Devgn
361.article_body: Ajay Devgn has said he tries to direct films that are not easy to make. "I like films that challenge me...If there's...story which inspires me so much that I feel like telling it myself, only then I direct it, otherwise, there's no point," he added. Ajay's 'Runway 34' marks his third directorial venture after 'U Me Aur Hum' and 'Shivaay'.

362.title: B'luru's 1st ANPR camera singles out 25 vehicles, recovers ₹19,900
362.article_body: First Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) camera that was deployed in Bengaluru last week has singled out 25 vehicles with pending cases and has recovered ₹19,900 as fine. The camera takes pictures of offenders and sends details of the offenders to the police personnel stationed nearby. The police then stops the vehicle and collects the fine.

363.title: US’ Nebraska wildfires kill ex-fire chief, injure 15 firefighters
363.article_body: A retired fire chief was killed and at least 15 firefighters were injured in wildfires that swept over parts of the US' Nebraska. According to an official, 66-year-old John P Trumble was overcome by smoke and fire after his vehicle went off-road owing to poor visibility. As many as 14 counties in the state have reported blazes since Friday.

364.title: Tarundeep Rai-Ridhi Phor win their 1st mixed team gold in Archery World Cup
364.article_body: Archers Tarundeep Rai and Ridhi Phor won their maiden recurve mixed team gold as they defeated Great Britain in the final of the Archery World Cup Stage 1. It's India's second gold in the tournament after the men's compound team won on Saturday. Pairing for the first time, 38-year-old Rai and 17-year-old Ridhi won 5-4 (35-37, 36-33, 39-40, 38-37, 18-17).

365.title: Malicious: B'luru DCP on religious procession route change request
365.article_body: Bengaluru city's DCP (South Division) Harish Pandey on Monday replied to a tweet by an organisation seeking to change the route of a temple's religious procession as it passed through areas "mostly inhabited by Muslims", saying, "This is a malicious attempt to create panic." He added that the procession is 35 years old and has "always been welcomed" by residents.

366.title: A boy used to inappropriately touch me after making me strip when I was 6: Kangana
366.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, in a recent episode of 'Lock Upp', revealed that she was sexually assaulted when she was aged around six. "A young boy from our town used to inappropriately touch me...He was three to four years elder than me. Perhaps he was exploring his sexuality. He'd call us, get us all to strip and check us," Kangana said.

367.title: Ranveer, Sara, Kriti & Madhuri attend Karan Johar's party, pics surface
367.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar recently hosted a dinner party for Global TV Head of Netflix, Bela Bajaria who arrived in Mumbai recently. The paparazzi spotted Madhuri Dixit, Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Sara Ali Khan, Kriti Sanon and other celebrities arriving at Karan's residence. Meanwhile, on the professional front, Karan recently announced a schedule wrap for 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'.

368.title: 2 shot dead in car speeding towards police in Paris after Macron wins election: Report
368.article_body: Paris police have shot two people dead and severely wounded a third person, a woman, after a car came speeding towards them on the oldest bridge in the French capital, Pont Neuf, reports said. The incident took place shortly after midnight, hours after French President Emmanuel Macron won a second term and protests broke out in the capital.

369.title: Freedom of expression doesn't give anyone right to abuse India: Vijayvargiya
369.article_body: BJP National General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya has said that freedom of expression in democracy does not give anyone the right to abuse India and go unpunished. "No other country addresses its nation as 'mother'...Are you okay if someone abuses your mother? Should such people who abuse our mother not be dealt with by law?" Vijayvargiya added.

370.title: Stronger kids bullied me in school, wanted to be a boxer to fight back: Vivek
370.article_body: Actor Vivek Oberoi said that "bigger and stronger" kids bullied him in boarding school and he wanted to be boxer to be able to fight them back. "I went to my coach...and he said, 'I will train you'..I ended up boxing not just for myself but for my school...I went to state-level and even competed at the nationals," Vivek added.

371.title: Hero Vired & INSEAD collaborate to launch new management program
371.article_body: Ed-tech company Hero Vired has partnered with world's leading management institute INSEAD to offer certificate program in Strategic Management and Business Essentials in India. The program will include up to 90% live learning, with 50% teaching sessions by INSEAD faculty. The program will cater to mid-senior professionals, entrepreneurs & senior leaders looking to upgrade their leadership skills.

372.title: Scindia, Singh inaugurate 'Yog Prabha' event at Safdarjung Airport
372.article_body: Union Ministers Jyotiraditya Scindia and General VK Singh on Monday inaugurated the mega Yoga event 'Yog Prabha' at Delhi's Safdarjung Airport. Over 500 Civil Aviation Ministry and its affiliated organisations' officials participated in the event. "Common Yoga Protocol, Lecture on Yoga by Expert [and] Yoga Demonstration will be...be undertaken at the event," a statement had said earlier.

373.title: Verstappen wins Emilia Romagna GP to close title gap to 27 points
373.article_body: Red Bull's Max Verstappen won the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix to move to the second place in the season's driver standings. He's now 27 points behind the Ferrari's Charles Leclerc, who finished sixth in the race. Verstappen's teammate Sergio Perez finished second while McLaren driver Lando Norris finished third. Mercedes' seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton finished 13th.

374.title: EOW inspector, constable arrested for taking bribe from Odisha journalist
374.article_body: The CBI arrested a constable of the Economic Offences Wing (EOW), Delhi, in Bhubaneswar on the charges of taking a bribe of ₹2 lakh from a journalist based in Odisha, promising to remove his name as a witness in a case of forgery. Inspector of EOW in Delhi police was also arrested by CBI in Delhi for masterminding the crime.

375.title: BJP seeks action against Atishi over Kerala officials visit claim
375.article_body: The Delhi BJP unit has sought action against AAP MLA Atishi after she said that officials from Kerala had visited the national capital to study the "Delhi model" of education. Earlier, Kerala Education Minister V Sivankutty had said that the state government hadn't sent anyone. "It's surprising how Atishi can make such false claims," Delhi BJP spokesperson Praveen Kapoor said.

376.title: I've noticed growth in Tiger; he has become calmer now: Tara Sutaria
376.article_body: Speaking about her 'Heropanti 2' co-star Tiger Shroff, actress Tara Sutaria said, "I've...noticed his growth as a co-actor and as a friend. I feel he's calmer and cool; with age, all of us tend to calm down." "His musical talent has grown. During 'Student Of The Year 2', I...noticed him humming. In 'Heropanti 2', he's singing as well," she added.

377.title: Most COVID-19 cases in Ghaziabad seen among people aged 21-40
377.article_body: Ghaziabad has registered 371 COVID-19 cases since April 12, most of which have been reported among people aged between 21 and 40 years. As many as 145 (39%) affected patients belonged to the 21-40 years age group. At the same time, the infection rate among those over 60 years was 7.8%, making them the least affected group.

378.title: 2 brothers electrocuted to death while working in the field in Pilibhit
378.article_body: Two brothers died due to an electric shock while working in their fields in UP's Pilibhit district. The deceased, identified as Rajendra Prasad (54) and Rameshwar Dayal (46), had gone to irrigate their fields when an iron bar, held by Rajendra, touched the wire of a nearby tubewell, police said. Notably, Rameshwar died while trying to save Rajendra.

379.title: It looked like he had no intent: Vettori on Pollard's 19(20) vs LSG
379.article_body: Ex-NZ captain Daniel Vettori has said it looked like MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard "had no intent" to score during their chase of LSG's 169-run target. "LSG did bowl well...and executed their strategies well," added Vettori. Pollard came in to bat when MI were 67/4 in the 12th over and scored 19 off 20 as LSG restricted MI to 132/8.

380.title: Man stabbed to death by uncles over consumption of liquor in Meerut
380.article_body: A 20-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death by his two uncles after a spat between the three over the consumption of liquor in Meerut's Lisari Gate area. The incident took place on Sunday when the deceased, Saajid, was returning home after offering namaz, police said. Notably, the accused had objected to the consumption of liquor by Saajid.

381.title: 18-year-old India-born student drowns in US while trying to retrieve football from pond
381.article_body: Clinten Ajit, an 18-year-old Kerala-born high school student, drowned while trying to retrieve a football from a pond in New Jersey. His body was recovered nearly three hours after he had drowned. Police are still investigating the events leading up to the 18-year-old's drowning. His family had immigrated to the US in September 2012 when he was eight years old.

382.title: 4 children injured as crude bombs explode near mosque in West Bengal
382.article_body: Four children were left injured after crude bombs exploded near a local mosque in West Bengal's Malda, police said. The incident reportedly took place when the children started playing with the crude bombs after mistaking them for balls. The condition of two of the children is critical and they are undergoing treatment at the Malda Medical College and Hospital.

383.title: Dilip Joshi, Johny Lever attend wedding reception of Rakesh Bedi’s daughter
383.article_body: Veteran actor Rakesh Bedi hosted a wedding reception for his daughter Ridhima in Mumbai, which was attended by Rakesh's friends from the industry. 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' actor Dilip Joshi, Johny Lever, Ramesh Sippy, Avtar Gill, Guddi Maruti and Mukesh Rishi were among the prominent celebrities who attended the wedding reception. Ridhima got married on March 20 in Delhi.

384.title: Delhi Metro ridership yet to reach pre-pandemic levels: DMRC
384.article_body: The passenger traffic in Delhi Metro has increased both on weekdays and weekends after various COVID-19 restrictions were lifted, but the footfall is still lower than the pre-COVID-19 pandemic levels, said a Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) official. According to DMRC data, the Metro ridership has reached only up to 66% of the pre-pandemic levels.

385.title: Senior Congress leader K Sankaranarayanan passes away at 89
385.article_body: Senior Congress leader K Sankaranarayanan passed away at his residence in Kerala's Palakkad on Sunday, aged 89. During his career, Sankaranarayanan served as Governor of Maharashtra, Nagaland and Jharkhand. He held additional charges of Goa, Arunachal Pradesh and Assam as Governor. He was four-time legislator and held agriculture, finance, excise, agriculture portfolios in governments in Kerala.

386.title: India reports 2,541 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases rise to 16,522
386.article_body: India has reported 2,541 COVID-19 cases, 1,862 recoveries and 30 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,593 COVID-19 cases and 44 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 16,522, while the death toll rose to 5,22,223.

387.title: KL Rahul reprimanded for 3rd time in IPL 2022, fined ₹24-lakh for slow over-rate
387.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul has been reprimanded for the third time in IPL 2022. He has been fined ₹24 lakh after his team maintained a slow over-rate against MI on Sunday. Earlier, Rahul was fined 20% of match fee for breaching Code of Conduct against RCB. He was fined ₹12 lakh over LSG's slow over-rate against MI on April 16.

388.title: PM Modi congratulates Macron on being re-elected as French Prez
388.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday took to Twitter to congratulate Emmanuel Macron on being re-elected as the President of France, saying, "I look forward to...working together to deepen the India-France Strategic Partnership." Macron won the elections by defeating far-right leader Le Pen with around 58% votes. "I am so proud to serve you again," Macron said on winning the re-election.

389.title: Accept money KCR gives, his bank balance will reduce: T'gana BJP chief
389.article_body: While accusing Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao of misappropriating government funds, state BJP chief Bandi Sanjay said that the people of state should accept the money that he distributes. "His bank balance will reduce...or else he will become richer and...you will become poor...Whatever the money he is distributing in election it is your money given by...PM Modi," he added.

390.title: Protests in Paris after Macron wins French President election, police use teargas
390.article_body: Riot police charged and sprayed teargas on demonstrators in central Paris protesting after President Emmanuel Macron was re-elected on Sunday. Macron defeated far-right leader Marine Le Pen. Notably, Macron is the first French President to win a second term in two decades, but Le Pen's result also marks the closest the far-right has ever come to taking power in France.

391.title: Loopholes in anti-defection law, needs amendment: Vice President
391.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu called for an amendment in the anti-defection law, stating that those lawmakers switching to other parties shouldn't be offered other posts before they are re-elected. "The anti-defection law has certain loopholes. It allows wholesale defection," Naidu added. "Most of the cases of defection are not effectively dealt with and are dealt with affection," Naidu stated.

392.title: Railways to remove encroachments near Pune's Talegaon station
392.article_body: The Pune railway division has given notices to 64 illegal encroachments near the Talegaon station, asking to vacate by April 26, failing which it will take action. The authorities said they will carry out an anti-encroachment drive if the defaulters didn't vacate even after repeated instructions. The people are not cooperating with the Railways, said an official.

393.title: I'm so bad at dancing that even rehearsals don't help: Ajay Devgn
393.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said he's so bad at dancing that he never does rehearsals because they don't help. He added that he regularly asks choreographers to change steps or tell them to do it because he can't do those steps. Ajay further said that the worst thing about his film 'Golmaal' was that he had to dance in the movie.

394.title: Twitter begins deal negotiations with Tesla CEO Elon Musk: Report
394.article_body: Twitter on Sunday began deal negotiations after Tesla CEO Elon Musk pursued many of the social media company's shareholders with financing details on his $43 billion acquisition offer, according to a Reuters report. Musk has said Twitter needs to be taken private to grow and become a genuine platform for free speech.

395.title: Called Salman, said 'I've announced it, it's Eid, are you ok': Ajay on Runway 34
395.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said that he did not realise that Eid will be falling in the same week as the release of his film 'Runway 34' during the announcement of release date. "First thing I did is...I called up Salman and said 'I've announced this date...it's Eid...are you ok?'. He said 'don't worry, I won't come that week'," Ajay added.

396.title: The season hasn't gone the way we wanted it to: Rohit after 8th defeat
396.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said that the ongoing IPL season hasn't gone the way they wanted it to after they lost their eighth match in the tournament. "[LSG's 169-run target] should've been chased down, but we didn't bat well enough...it [was] important to string partnerships. But [we played] some irresponsible shots in the middle, including [me]," stated Rohit.

397.title: Right-wing groups object to B'luru school making students carry Bible
397.article_body: After a school in Bengaluru reportedly took an undertaking from parents to allow students to carry Bibles, right-wing groups objected to it, calling it a violation of the Karnataka Education Act. A Hindu Janajagruti Samiti (HJS) spokesperson claimed that it was forcing non-Christians to learn Bible's teachings. The school, however, said that it provides Bible-based education, according to reports.

398.title: Pregnant woman arrested with cocaine worth ₹51 lakh in Mumbai
398.article_body: A 30-year-old pregnant woman from Mumbai's Borivali has been arrested for possession of cocaine worth ₹51 lakh. Police said the woman, who is the wife of an ambulance driver, was using the ambulance to deliver drugs. A police team interrogated her after they spotted her standing near St Francis School, Borivali suspiciously, while holding a small transparent bag.

399.title: Labourer kills man in fight over alcohol money in Pune; arrested
399.article_body: A labourer was arrested for allegedly hitting a man on the head with a rod, leading to the latter's death, after a fight broke out between them over money for alcohol in Pune. The deceased roamed around with a head injury for two days before dying, a police officer said. Head injury had led to internal bleeding, police officer added.

400.title: Pune to have cloudy sky till April-end, rain likely on 2 days: IMD
400.article_body: Pune will continue to have cloudy weather till the end of April, IMD has predicted. "Till April 30, the forecast states that the sky shall remain cloudy," said Anupam Kashyapi, head of the weather forecasting department at IMD, Pune. The city is also likely to witness light rainfall on April 27 and 28, Kashyapi added.
